title: Radio filaments as Z-pinched Galactic center wind
abstract:
In this brief note, we tentatively investigate the possibility that the radio
filaments are produced when the Galactic center wind washes over magnetic field
structures. The electrons and ions, with their disparate charge-to-mass ratios,
are deflected differently by the magnetic field, and a current results. The
current is subsequently Z-pinched into filaments, creating an
electron-accelerating electric field along the way, because the magnetic field
necessarily rearranges during the dynamic constriction process. An axial
magnetic field also arises, possibly via the diocotron channel, to eventually
quench the pinching and stabilize the filaments against a variety of
instabilities.
